metadata.Title: CVE-2022-22760 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: When importing resources using Web Workers, error messages would distinguish the difference between application/javascript responses and non-script responses. This could have been abused to learn information cross-origin. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 97, Thunderbird < 91.6, and Firefox ESR < 91.6. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22760` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro thunderbird - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '97.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
